name: Arachnodelic
description:
Arachnodelic is a psychedelic endless runner where you play as a spider trying to catch bugs and avoid bug bombs. Everything starts off relatively normal, with a classy black and white style, but as you level up... things get weird!

Made for casual gameplay and short play sessions, Arachnodelic challenges you to beat your best scores by deciding when (and if) you want to level up. You get a sweet score multiplier each level, of course, but can you avoid getting blown up as the game tries to distract you with crazy colors and special effects?

At this time, Arachnodelic is available for Windows only, tested in Windows 10 64-bit edition, and opens in a standalone player. You can choose the resolution and choose between windowed and fullscreen.

The controls are simple - move left and right using either the arrows, or the A and D keys. Pause with the Escape key. You can also control the music and SFX volumes in the menu.

This is our second completed game! We - my husband and I - are Red Nebula Studios, and this game was completed as a self-imposed "make a game in 1 month" challenge, like our first game, Rat-a-Sewey. It was made in Unity and completed between July 20th and August 20th, 2019. I did the artwork and programming, and my husband and I worked together on the sound effects. A big thank you to Eric Matyas of www.soundimage.org for the music!

I have also documented the game dev process over on my YouTube channel, Ms.RedNebula. Please feel free to take a look if you'd like to see how this project came together!

8/21/2019 Patch - Uploaded version 1.02 which fixed a glitch where high scores would sometimes not be registered properly. Sorry about that!
